labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.9-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79587 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+vq+260103@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Pixel 7 Pro /Android 16 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Use the Expensifail account to have the beta enabled for GPS 1. Open the Hybrid app 2. Tap on the FAB 3. Select Track distance 4. Select GPS and allow the background running 5. Tap on the Account > Troubleshoot 6. Switch to OD 7. Tap on the App to open again ## Expected Result: The app should display a warning about GPS when switching between ND and OD ## Actual Result: Android: The app keeps crashing. iOS: No warning when the user switches to OD and logs out, after that, can't log in to the iOS app again with the Magic code ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9d8bdd51-2e58-45d6-9201-55442ea214c6 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8dc82d1e-b735-4d09-a6dc-268525b2cde6 [logs.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24877472/logs.txt) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution

**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition: Have a self-DM
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to self-DM
3. Create two manual expenses
4. Click "Submit it to someone" in the actionable whisper of one expense and choose a user
5. Click the back arrow twice
6. Click "Submit it to someone" on the other expense and choose a user

## Expected Result:
Confirm details page only shows the last expense

## Actual Result:
Confirm details page shows both expenses

## Workaround:
Unknown

Stop the trip and log out, log in again and check that after starting the trip and showing the start address there is no tooltip

GPS tooltips still appear when starting GPS after log out and login again

labels.name: Help Wanted

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.9-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/27754595/test-cases/77992811
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 26.1
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: Create an Admin and a Member, selecting "Manage my team's expenses" option

1. As Admin, invite the Member to the workspace
2. As Member, create 2 expenses in your own workspace chat, click Submit
3. As Member, open the report, click More - Change workspace - Admin's workspace
4. As Admin, navigate to the Member's workspace chat, open the expense report - there is no Approve option
5. As Admin, select one of the expenses - More menu - there is no Reject option
6. As a Member, open the workspace report - there is an Approve option, but the system message says "Waiting for Admin to approve expenses"

## Expected Result:
Approve option is displayed in the expense report for the workspace Admin after submitter changed the workspace. Reject option is available in the expense details/ More menu

## Actual Result:
For Admin: Approve button and option are not displayed, system message says "Waiting for Member to approve expenses". Reject option is not available in the expense details
For Member: Approve button is displayed, but system message says "Waiting for Admin to approve expenses".

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

Go to a workspace 2. Create an expense for $200 as a submitter 3. Click on "More" and select "Split" 4. Click on the "Date" pill 5. Click on the "Split dates" 6. Set the start date as the 16th 7. Set the end date as the 18th and tap Save 8. Verify that three splits are created with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount Result: The split dates are created for 15, 16, and 17 instead of 16, 17, and 18. 9. Try with another day ranges Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date ## Expected Result: Three splits are created from start day to end day (16, 17, and 18), with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount. ## Actual Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date (15,16,17) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f6b0b8d8-82f3-4af3-a3fb-902c3a0028fd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.8-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176933/test-cases/41237708 https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176944/test-cases/41237731 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Create a workspace 3. Create a scan expense with a valid receipt in the workspace chat 4. Create another scan expense in the workspace chat, uploading an image, that will fail the scan 5. When the scan is completed, open the expense details 6. Start a group chat, create a split - scan - upload an image, that will fail the scan 7. When scan is failed, open the details ## Expected Result: Step 5 - The amount field is empty and have the error state displayed Step 7 - The amount field is empty, shows an error, has a right caret and editable. The Split button is presented ## Actual Result: Step 5 - The amount field is filled with $0.00 and does not show an error. When clicking on the field, the amount input is empty. Step 7 - For failed scan split in group the amount field is filled with $0.00, the field is not editable. User is not able to edit the split ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0cafbb3-8893-4ba8-b19d-b09d0bd97329 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.8-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13177075/test-cases/41237824 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Set the test account as follows: - Account > Preferences > Payment currency > USD - Account > Wallet > Enable Wallet (select US bank account, and add a Wallet) 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com. 2. Sign in with the user who has a Wallet added. 3. Open a chat with a user that does not have an account yet. 4. Click on + within the chat > Pay {Username} > select an amount, then click Next. 5. Click Pay > Pay with Wallet. 6. Open the expense report. 7. In the chat, click X next to the error message: “Unexpected error. Please try again later.” (displayed below the “Paid with Wallet” comment). ## Expected Result: After dismissing an error when attempting to Pay with Wallet, the expense report should disappear (same behaviour as when dismissing the error with 'X' below the receipt) ## Actual Result: After dismissing an error when attempting to Pay with Wallet, the expense report enters an endless loading state. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a8a622f4-9e40-46e7-80fe-2ef489270d7b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
